LanguageData.Plant_Agave.label: agave
LanguageData.Plant_Agave.description: A large-leafed desert plant with edible flowers and stalks.
LanguageData.Plant_Berry.label: raspberry bush
LanguageData.Plant_Berry.description: Raspberry bushes are plants that produce fragile, red, bumpy fruits called raspberries.
LanguageData.Plant_TreeCocoa.label: Cocoa Tree
LanguageData.Plant_TreeCocoa.description: Cocoa Trees produce seeds in pods that are called Cocoa Beans. Cocoa Beans can be refined into chocolate.
LanguageData.Plant_TreeApple.label: Apple Tree
LanguageData.Plant_TreeApple.description: Apple Trees produce round, palm-sized, red fruits called Apples. The Apple Tree will remain after harvesting and will start another cycle of Apple production.
LanguageData.Plant_TreeBanana.label: Banana Tree
LanguageData.Plant_TreeBanana.description: Banana Trees produce long, yellow fruits called Bananas, which eventually soften into a sweet delight. The Banana Tree will remain after harvesting and will start another cycle of Banana production.
LanguageData.Plant_TreeOrange.label: Orange Tree
LanguageData.Plant_TreeOrange.description: Orange Trees produce sweet, citric fruits called Oranges. The Orange Tree will remain after harvesting and will start another cycle of Orange production.
LanguageData.Plant_TreePeach.label: peach tree
LanguageData.Plant_TreePeach.description: Peach trees produce soft, fuzzy, sweet fruits called peaches. The peach tree will remain after harvesting and will start another cycle of peach production.
LanguageData.Plant_TreeGrape.label: grape vine
LanguageData.Plant_TreeGrape.description: Grape vines produce small, sweet berries that grow in clusters on a single branch. These fruits are called grapes.
